image_models.utils package¶

Submodules¶

image_models.utils.tools module¶

image_models.utils.tools.build_list_images(datapath, types=None)[source]¶

Builds a list of all image files in a given directory :param datapath: the location to search :param types: a tuple of the extensions to search, if unspecified a list of defaults is checked

Returns

a list of the datapaths to the images

Return type

paths

image_models.utils.tools.create_image_mask_dirs(image_path, mask_path, dest)[source]¶

Creates a data structure comensurate with the patch_flow_from_file function. :param image_path: the original location of the images (str). :param mask_path: the original location of the masks (str). :param dest: the directory where image and mask folders should be built (str).

image_models.utils.tools.inference_binary_segmentation(datapath, patch_shape, img_shape, model, file_prefix='binary_mask', savepath='.', fig_size=20, 8, debug=False, batch_size=1)[source]¶

Function to plot and save an image of the binary mask. :param datapath: the folder where the images to treat are located :param file_prefix: the prefix for the saved file name :param savepath: the path to the location to save the files :param patch_shape: pixel shape of the patch :param img_shape: pixel shape of the original image :param fig_size: the size of the images to produce :param model: the loaded Keras model :param batch_size: the batch size for running prediction model

image_models.utils.tools.slide_slice_image(dir, types, origin, size, num, savedir)[source]¶

Function to continuously slide across an image making patches :param dir: str the directory containing the image/mask to be sliced. Image file is expected to be called image.extension and mask called mask.extension :param types: list; the type of file to look for eg [‘.tif’] or [‘.tif’, ‘.png’] etc :param origin: tuple (x, y) the origin of the first patch :param size: tuple (w, h) the size of each patch :param num: the number of patches to make :param savedir: str; the directory to save the patches to - will put them in Images and Masks directories.
